sentence: Looking at the universe of stocks we cover at Dividend Channel , on 1/17/19, Procter & Gamble Company (Symbol: PG), Oxford Industries, Inc. (Symbol: OXM), and WD-40 Co (Symbol: WDFC) will all trade ex-dividend for their respective upcoming dividends.

Procter & Gamble Company will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.7172 on 2/15/19, Oxford Industries, Inc. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.34 on 2/1/19, and WD-40 Co will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.61 on 1/31/19.

As a percentage of PG's recent stock price of $91.80, this dividend works out to approximately 0.78%, so look for shares of Procter & Gamble Company to trade 0.78% lower - all else being equal - when PG shares open for trading on 1/17/19.
Similarly, investors should look for OXM to open 0.46% lower in price and for WDFC to open 0.36% lower, all else being equal.
Below are dividend history charts for PG, OXM, and WDFC, showing historical dividends prior to the most recent ones declared.
In general, dividends are not always predictable, following the ups and downs of company profits over time.
Therefore, a good first due diligence step in forming an expectation of annual yield going forward, is looking at the history above, for a sense of stability over time.
This can help in judging whether the most recen t dividends from these companies are likely to continue.
If they do continue, the current estimated yields on annualized basis would be 3.13% for Procter & Gamble Company , 1.83% for Oxford Industries, Inc., and 1.43% for WD-40 Co.
In Tuesday trading, Procter & Gamble Company shares are currently up about 0.7%, Oxford Industries, Inc. shares are up about 0.3%, and WD-40 Co shares are up about 0.5% on the day.
